document.docAuthor: Gomes, Eliane Solar, Ale-Rocha, Rosaly & Keppler, Ruth Leila Ferreira
document.docTitle: Stenomicra urbana Gomes & Ale-Rocha & Keppler 2018, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: A new species of Stenomicra Coquillett (Diptera: Periscelididae) from the Brazilian Amazon and its life history

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new species of Stenomicra Coquillett (Diptera: Periscelididae) from the Brazilian Amazon and its life history

subSubSection.paragraph: Adult. Diagnosis. This species can be differentiated from congeners by the following set of features: Thorax and abdomen yellow except for dorsal, wide, median, brown stripe, extended from anterior margin to middle of scutum, scutellum with brownish apex, and a small brown spot on anepimerum of males and anepimerum and katepisternum of females, third and fourth tergites of males, plus posterior margin of second tergite of females; two dorsocentral postsutural setae developed, posterior stronger and longer, twice as long as anterior; wing hyaline, section R4+5-M1 a little shorter than section R2+3-R4+5; legs yellow with coxae, trochanters, base of femora, mid tibia and mid tarsus pale-yellow; fore femur with two long and strong setae on posteroventral surface near apex.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–4.
Alocasia macrorrhizos
(L.) G. Don ( Araceae ) at an urban forest fragment at Campus II of Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas da Amazônia/INPA, Manaus, Brazil; 2–4,
Stenomicra urbana
sp. nov. :
2, head, anterior view; 3,
Stenomicra urbana
sp. nov.
, habitus, lateral view; 4,
Stenomicra urbana
sp. nov.
, habitus, dorsal view.

subSubSection.paragraph: Female: as in the male except for postpedicel with dorsal stain brown, anepimeron and katepisternum with a large brownish stain, and distal margin of second tergite brownish. Terminalia (Figs 8, 9): syntergosternite T7+S6+S7 longer ventrally than dorsally; sternite 8 reduced to a narrow weakly sclerotized strap; hypoproct rather rectangular; cerci short. Two spherical spermathecae hardly pigmented (Fig. 10).

Type material: Holotype male ( INPA ): BRASIL ,
Amazonas
, Manaus / INPA-Campus II / 20–24. iv.2017 / Armadilha Suspensa com septo amarelo / Gomes, E.S. & Ferreira-Keppler, R.L
.
Paratypes : same data of holotype , 17♂ , 6 ♀ ( INPA )
. Condition of holotype: good, not dissected.
Etymology. From the Latin urbanus (“of the city”), in reference to the collection site.

Remarks. Two species were previously known from the Amazon,
Stenomicra amazonensis
and
Stenomicra manausensis ( Freitas & Ale-Rocha 2011 )
.
Stenomicra urbana
sp. nov.
can be easily distinguished from those species by the yellow scutum with wide brown stripe on anterior half, acrostichal series uniserial, all legs yellow, wing hyaline and tergites yellow except T3 and T4 brown. In
S. amazonensis
the scutum is brown, the mid femur is brown on anterodorsal surface, the hind femur is brown with yellow tip and base and the basal halves of mid and hind tibiae are brown, the wing is smoothly darkened and the tergites are brown except for T1 and T4, which are yellow. In
S. manausensis
the scutum is yellow with posterior margin brown and the acrostichal series is biserial. The male terminalia offers the most important characters to distinguish
Stenomicra urbana
sp. nov.
from those Amazonian species: the lobe of the cercus is elongate and slender (the lobe is short and robust in
S. amazonensis
and reduced, almost imperceptible, in
S. manausensis
) and the surstylus is sharpened apically with thin and sparse setae on the apex (the surstylus is robust and totally covered with short and strong setae in
S. amazonensis
, with long and strong setae and apex slightly enlarged in
S. manausensis
).

caption.paragraph: FIGURES 5–7. Male terminalia (paratype): 5, epandrium, cerci and surstyli, posterodorsal view; 6, epandrium, cerci and surstyli and internal terminalia, lateral view; 7, hypandrium, phallus and aedeagal apodeme, ventral view. 8–10 female terminalia: 8, dorsal view; 9, ventral view; 10, spermatheca. Scale bar: Figs 5–9 = 0.3 mm; Fig 10 = 0.1 mm. Abbreviations: cerc—cercus; eja apod—ejaculatory apodeme; epand—epandrium; pregt—pregonite; ph—phallus; sur—surstylus.

subSubSection.paragraph: Puparium (Figs 20, 21). Description. Average length 4.09 mm (n=11). Yellow-orange and conceal the exuvium of the final larval instar. Body slightly robust and wider in the middle, elliptical in profile, slightly tapering towards anterior end and truncated at apex; first thoracic segment with a small digitiform process (vestige of anterior spiracle); eight abdominal segments, each with two rows of micro thorns; last abdominal segment with small transverse anal slit and with bifid pointed process posteriorly. Pupa approximately half length of puparium.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 11–17. Third instar lava of
Stenomicra urbana
sp. nov.
: 11, habitus, lateral view; 12, habitus, dorsal view; 13, head and prothorax, dorsal view; 14,, anterior spiracle; 15, abdominal terminal segment, bifurcated spiracular process, dorsal view; 16, SEM of locomotory welts, ventral view; 17, SEM of abdominal terminal segment, bifurcated spiracular process and anal pads, ventral view. SEM= scanning electron micrographs.
